mef.name: Matrix Embedding Framework
mef.longDescription: Framework for structuring knowledge into versioned UKIs, enabling traceability and governance of organizational knowledge.

zof.name: Zion Orchestration Framework
zof.longDescription: Orchestrates conceptual workflows and coordinates hybrid human-AI teams through structured collaboration patterns.

oif.name: Operator Intelligence Framework
oif.longDescription: Defines artificial intelligence archetypes and interaction patterns for practical execution in development teams.

moc.name: Matrix Ontology Catalog
moc.longDescription: Catalog of organizational hierarchies that defines taxonomies, ontologies, and governance structures adapted to context.

mal.name: Matrix Arbiter Layer
mal.longDescription: Arbitration system that resolves knowledge conflicts and ensures organizational governance through auditable decisions.

page.title: Matrix Protocol Frameworks
page.subtitle: Explore the five operational frameworks that compose the protocol
page.description: Each framework addresses a specific aspect of human-AI collaboration, organized in three interdependent layers: Oracle, Zion, and Operator.

layers.title: Three-Layer Architecture
layers.description: The Matrix Protocol is organized in three interdependent layers that cover from strategic governance to practical execution.
layers.oracleDesc: Strategic governance and knowledge base management
layers.zionDesc: Conceptual workflow and hybrid team orchestration
layers.operatorDesc: Practical execution and implementation by development teams

mepSpecial.title: Matrix Epistemic Principle
mepSpecial.subtitle: The epistemological manifest of the protocol
mepSpecial.description: Unlike operational frameworks, MEP is purely conceptual - it defines the philosophical foundations for knowledge treatment.

mep.title: Epistemological Principle
mep.description: The manifest that defines how knowledge is treated in the protocol
mep.longDescription: MEP establishes the philosophical foundations of how knowledge is structured, evaluated, and promoted in the Matrix Protocol. Unlike other frameworks, it is purely conceptual.

oracle.title: Oracle Layer
oracle.description: Strategic governance and knowledge base that underpins the entire protocol

zion.title: Zion Layer
zion.description: Orchestration of conceptual workflows for hybrid human-AI teams

operator.title: Operator Layer
operator.description: Practical execution and implementation by development teams

relationships.title: How Frameworks Relate
relationships.description: Visualize the connections and dependencies between the five operational frameworks organized in the three protocol layers.
relationships.mefToZof: MEF feeds ZOF with structured knowledge
relationships.zofToOif: ZOF coordinates OIF in hybrid workflows
relationships.mocToAll: MOC governs hierarchies of all frameworks
relationships.malArbitrates: MAL arbitrates conflicts between all frameworks
relationships.understandingDesc: Understanding these relationships is fundamental to effectively implement Matrix Protocol in your organization.

cta.title: Start Using Matrix Protocol
cta.description: Implement structured human-AI collaboration in your organization

fallback.intro: is one of the five main frameworks of Matrix Protocol Beta.
fallback.getStartedIntro: To start using {framework}, follow the steps below:

mep.subtitle: The epistemological manifest of Matrix Protocol
mep.quote: Knowledge is malleable; authority is derived; explainability is mandatory.

whatIs.title: What is MEP?
whatIs.description1: The Matrix Epistemic Principle (MEP) is the epistemological manifest that establishes the philosophical foundations of how knowledge is treated, evaluated and promoted in the Matrix Protocol.
whatIs.description2: Unlike operational frameworks (MEF, ZOF, OIF, MAL), MEP is purely conceptual — it defines the 'why' and 'when' to apply epistemological principles.
whatIs.description3: MEP functions as the 'epistemological constitution' that guides MAL (Matrix Arbiter Layer) in arbitration, conflict, and knowledge governance decisions.

principles.title: The 5 Fundamental Principles
principles.subtitle: Epistemological pillars that guide the entire Matrix Protocol

semantic.title: Semantic Elasticity
semantic.description: Knowledge must be able to adapt to different organizational contexts while maintaining its essence.
semantic.impact: Enables intelligent reuse of knowledge across teams and projects.

stratified.title: Stratified Epistemology
stratified.description: System of epistemic maturity levels: draft → validated → approved.
stratified.impact: Ensures controlled and auditable evolution of organizational knowledge.

promotion.title: Responsible Promotion
promotion.description: All knowledge evolution must be accompanied by clear epistemological justification.
promotion.impact: Ensures transparency and accountability in knowledge decisions.

authority.title: Derived Authority
authority.description: Authority is established relative to organizational context, not in absolute terms.
authority.impact: Creates flexible governance adapted to each organization's reality.

explainability.title: Necessary Explainability
explainability.description: All knowledge must have an auditable and understandable epistemological narrative.
explainability.impact: Makes organizational knowledge transparent and questionable.

frameworks.title: Relationship with Frameworks
frameworks.description: MEP philosophically guides all operational frameworks of Matrix Protocol
frameworks.mef: Applies semantic elasticity principles in UKI structuring
frameworks.zof: Uses stratified epistemology for workflow evolution
frameworks.oif: Implements derived authority in AI archetypes
frameworks.mal: Executes responsible promotion in arbitration decisions

protocol.title: Protocol Core
protocol.description: MEP is the philosophical foundation of all components

applications.title: Practical Applications
applications.description: How MEP manifests in organizational practice

cta.title: Implement MEP Principles
cta.description: Transform your organization with a solid and auditable epistemological foundation

hero.title: Matrix Protocol
hero.subtitle: Epistemological framework for human-AI collaboration
hero.description: A semantic protocol that connects humans and AI through three interdependent layers: Oracle, Zion, and Operator. Providing governance, traceability, and organizational adaptability.

frameworks.title: Five Integrated Frameworks
frameworks.subtitle: Each framework addresses a specific aspect of human-AI collaboration, from knowledge structuring to conflict arbitration.
frameworks.viewAllDescription: Explore how the five frameworks work together

features.title: Why Matrix Protocol?
features.subtitle: Four fundamental pillars that make Matrix Protocol the ideal foundation for structured and governable human-AI collaboration.

epistemological.title: Epistemological Foundation
epistemological.description: Solid philosophical base with clear principles for treatment, evaluation, and promotion of knowledge in human-AI collaborations.

semantic.title: Semantic Structure
semantic.description: Structured knowledge organization via UKIs (Units of Knowledge Interlinked) with versioning and complete traceability.

collaboration.title: AI Collaboration
collaboration.description: Specialized artificial intelligence archetypes and conceptual workflows optimized for hybrid human-AI teams.

governance.title: Integrated Governance
governance.description: Arbitration and conflict resolution system that ensures compliance, audit, and organizational adaptability.

mep.title: Matrix Epistemic Principle
mep.subtitle: Five fundamental principles that guide knowledge treatment in the protocol.

p1.title: Semantic Elasticity
p1.description: Knowledge ability to adapt to different organizational contexts.

p2.title: Stratified Epistemology
p2.description: System of epistemic maturity levels (draft → validated → approved).

p3.title: Responsible Promotion
p3.description: Knowledge evolution accompanied by epistemological justification.

p4.title: Derived Authority
p4.description: Relative authority based on organizational context, not absolute.

p5.title: Necessary Explainability
p5.description: Mandatory requirement for auditable epistemological narrative.

quickStart.title: Getting Started
quickStart.subtitle: Three essential steps to implement Matrix Protocol in your organization and begin structured human-AI collaboration.

step1.title: Choose Template
step1.description: Select a MOC template suitable for your organization size. Available for small, medium, and large companies.

step2.title: Configure Ontology
step2.description: Customize the MOC (Matrix Ontology Catalog) with your organization's hierarchies, taxonomies, and governance rules.

step3.title: Create UKIs
step3.description: Structure your knowledge into UKIs (Units of Knowledge Interlinked) using MEF to begin collaboration.

final.title: Ready to Collaborate?
final.description: With these three steps, you'll have the foundation needed to start using Matrix Protocol in your organization.
